messages.title: Re-Elect Michael Meacher on Thursday 7th May
messages.content: I have been privileged to represent Oldham West and Royton in Parliament since 1970 and am proud of the way through my office in Church Lane we have been able to offer assistance to thousands of Oldham people in both local and national matters. We want to continue to provide that help whenever people need it, and I am asking for your support again on 7 May.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will move away from austerity and cuts. We will return the NHS as a fully public service.
We will introduce a Living Wage.

issues.economy: Five years of Tory/LibDem rule have devastated Oldham. Never-ending austerity has pushed down wages by 10% or more, and too many jobs are low-paid, insecure, and zero hour contracts.
issues.governance: Huge government cuts have crippled local government services.
issues.health: Labour will move away from austerity and cuts. We will return the NHS as a fully public service.
issues.socialWelfare: Huge government cuts have squeezed the NHS, undermined social care for the elderly and disabled, imposed the bedroom tax, and withdrawn support for the poorest and most vulnerable families.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have the experience, integrity and skills to best represent you.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Oldham West and Royton
politicalExperience.achievements: Proud of the assistance provided to thousands through my office in Church Lane.
